name: Hyatt Windward Pointe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay at Windward Pointe the first week of March. As others have stated, there is construction on Route A1A. The construction did not stop anyone from going to the pool area. It looks like once they finish the right-hand side of the road, they are going to do the left-hand side of the road. So construction will be there through the rest of this year.
reviews.title: Very nice and relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is at the end of the Key West Airport. I had been concerned about noise, but to my surprise it wasn't that bad. The planes and small jets take off and are gone very quickly. It is not a busy airport.
reviews.title: Nice resort - some noise

reviews.text: The suites are very nice. There are two bedrooms, kitchen, dining area and living room area. All floors of the suite are tiled. All suites have a view of the Atlantic Ocean from their balconies. Being on the east side of the island allows one to view the sunrise. We only had to walk across the street to get a spectacular view. The grounds of the resort are very well maintained. There is also a small place by the pool where you can order food and drinks. Their hours are 10AM to 6PM. Happy hour is 3PM to 6PM. We have been told that the resort doesn't cater to the "Spring Break" crowd. I don't know if this is true or not, but closing the bar area at 6PM doesn't allow late night drinking on the resort grounds.
reviews.title: Paradise!

likes.liked: — The size of the rooms and the balcony

reviews.title: American Carribean
reviews.text: The concierge at the resort will arrange off site activities at a discount price. We rented bikes through the concierge and the company
delivered the bikes to us. The same goes for scooters. The boating excursions the resort deals with are not the party ones.
reviews.title: Everything great except construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the property, pool, and grounds. The rooms were very nice and loved the spacious porch area. The construction was noticeable and annoying. We couldn't believe one night when we heard jackhammering at 10:30pm!! Also, they advertise their new wireless internet available...what they don't tell you is that it costs $59.99 for a week's access!!!
reviews.title: Had a good time

reviews.text: My family stayed for 3 nights the first week of June. Upon arrival we were told that the elevator was broken and that we would have to carry our luggage to the 3rd floor - we were reassured that it would be fixed the next day. It wasn't fixed by the time we left. The room itself was lovely - beautiful kitchen and good sized bedrooms. But, the mattresses in both beds were quite uncomfortable - comparable to one you would find on a pull out couch. Apparently they have "daily tidy and towel service" but no one ever came to tidy or make the beds and on the 2nd day of our stay we had to call the front desk twice for someone to bring clean towels to the room.
reviews.title: Not what it should be
Awsome cannot say enough
reviews.text: At close to $400 a night, the amenities and service should match the price. We would not stay here again.

reviews.title: Good Rooms, location is a liitle far from downtown
reviews.text: This was our home from may 19-26/07 we could not have felt more at home. As everyone has mentioned construction right infront of the hotel but no big deal and the airport never even knew it was there, true a little far from downtown but all in all you had your chance to relax without to much noise, rooms were great,hotel staff very helpful and as nice as could be. We even made friends with the racoons,if you stay in room 513 we were feeding them so they hung out all week, as for key west oh my god i will be back again and again . Awsome week We came back different people the hotel just says relax no worries.

reviews.title: Hyatt Windward Pointe - Worth It
reviews.text: Good rooms and nice spot - they are working on rt 1 as everyone has mentioned - not a party spot - family oriented. If you are looking to hang on duval st - this is not the place - but if you have kids - go for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is really nice, wonderful rooms, beautiful grounds, etc. But please beware! If you are planning on staying here in the near future, there is road construction going on about 20 feet from the actual hotel property. We were disappointed in this discovery when we checked in, hoping to have a couple of relaxing days by the pool over looking the ocean. Instead we didn't even make it out to the pool because of the mind numbing noise from bulldosers, jack hammers, tractors, and any other road construction machine you can think of. We couldn't even sit on our deck because of the noise. It started early morning and continued into mid evening. We did orginally ask if we could cancel our 2 night reservation but because we booked it through expedia we were pretty much tossed around in a circle and although the Hyatt admitted that there was in fact construction going on, since it is not on their property they didn't feel as if they should grant us our request with out charging us for one night. So we did stay. Again very nice hotel, wish they had an actual resturant and a fitness room, but if you are looking for quiet and relaxation I would avoid this hotel until they can tell you the road construction is complete. We did spend one night out of 3 down the street at the Sheraton Suites and really enjoyed the peace and quiet there.
reviews.title: Great hotel but beware of construction

likes.disliked: — Difficult to work with if wanting to cancel reservation and construction

reviews.text: I absolutely loved it there! The rooms were huge and comfortable, I didn't want to leave! It was very clean and refreshing. The pool was awesome! I spent most of everyday I was there at the pool. The balcony was the perfect size and we had a nice view of the courtyard, pool, and ocean. The only thing that was a bit inconvenient was the airport, but it was not THAT bad. When inside the condo, you could not hear it, and when you were outside you eventually got used to the noise. I, being only 12 years old, normally get very homesick at night when I'm not in my home, but here, I was not homesick at all. I slept peacefully, even though I was on the pullout couch. It was only a short drive to where all the action in town was taking place, which we did not mind at all. I can't wait to stay there again, for it was an amazing experience and since I've been there, no hotel I've stayed at has been better.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I apologize my review is a little late. We stayed at Windward Pointe the 1st week in June. Loved the location and the room. We had a 2BR/2BA room with the balcony facing the ocean. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bed was a little uncomfortable, but that is my only complaint. The staff was very nice and helpful. Also, we didn't have any issues being by the airport - we were never distrubed by the airplanes. We stocked up at the local Publix on food items. The kitchen really came in handy. (They don't provide free coffee in the room but have it in their lobby). Also in the room they have a hair dryer, iron/ironing board, pool towels, dishes, silverwear and a telescope! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Fantastic Choice!

reviews.text: My husband and 14 yr old daughter spent a week at the end of March '06 at the Hyatt Windward Pointe Hotel. They loved the unit, had no problem with soaps/shampoos being replaced daily (as someone did in a recent post). The airport being close by was not a problem-- they were out during the day and the plane noise stopped around 10pm so they slept in peace & quiet. Only one thing- we had requested a room with a rounded balcony and when I called to confirm before their visit I was assurred they were booked into just such a room, but upon their arrival it was not a room with a rounded balcony and they had to lean over the railing to get a view of the ocean. It is a pricey place to stay so we felt those two items could've been handled better. Other than that they were happy with the service, cleanliness, accomodations in general.
reviews.title: A Great Place To Stay

reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and another couple. Accomadations are perfect. Loved the ocean view, the pool and grounds are well kept.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Our daughter moved to Key West last year, so this was our first visit to the area. We were looking for a place to stay for 2 couples. After much research, we made our reservations here. Price wise, it was a little more than getting two rooms at the hotel we were considering and looked to have many more perks than a regular hotel room.
reviews.title: Loved it......

likes.liked: — Location away from Duval Street, Ocean view
likes.disliked: — Can't really think of anything major

reviews.title: Nice Runway
reviews.text: When we arrived, the check-in was quick and smooth. The condo was beautiful and just as nice as we had hoped. It was clean and nicely decorated. The kitchen was lovely. Master bath was huge. Loved the balcony and the view (which was very similar to the traveler's photos posted here for this place..... I swear, those folks must've been right next door!). I was a little concerned about the airport being next door, but it turned out to be not a problem at all. The only time we heard the planes was when we were sitting on the balcony, and then it was a quick takeoff and they were gone. When we were inside the condo, we didn't hear them at all. It's a very small airport with not alot of air traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a couple small issues......
reviews.title: Perfect Place for the Perfect Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The telescope was a nice touch - I spent hours watching the stars at night as well as the boats during the day.
likes.disliked: — Internet was $10.00 per 24 hours. However, when you're on vacation you should disconnect completely. The cost was a good deterant for me to seperate from the real world and enjoy. Although a lot of people whined about this in other reviews, my opinion is... leave business and e-mail on the mainland; live the island life - ditch the laptop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew that there would be a charge for internet access, so that wasn't a surprise. (It seems to me that, more often than not, internet isn't free anymore.... And the more expensive the property, the more likely the charge.) It took several calls to get the internet access working for us. It would work for a minute and then shut down. It would be nice to just have it work without having to call the help desk, leave a message, and then wait for them to call you back. We waited.... finally called them back..... they said they hadn't gotten the message. The same thing happened the second day, but at least they did call us back right away. All in all, it wasn't a huge thing..... just annoying.
reviews.title: Wireless through the nose

likes.disliked: — Their attitude from the corporation standpoint, not the indivisuals

reviews.text: Another thing was that the bed in the master bedroom was a bit soft and probably could stand to be replaced. It also seemed low to the ground (and I'm only 5'3"). It didn't keep me from getting a good nights sleep. I'd rather have a mattress that's too soft as opposed to a very firm one, so it wasn't an issue for me, but might be for someone else. I didn't ask the other couple if their bed was alright and they didn't mention it, so I can't comment on that.
reviews.title: Everything was wonderful!!

likes.liked: — The rooms had everything we needed.

aka: Hyatt Windward Pointe Hotel Key West
description: Contemporary vacation resort; residential styled units with fully equipped kitchens and dining areas; ocean views.
